name: Teeny Tiny Loop
description:
Introduction

Tiny has an upper pothole section, an open middle section that makes a 90 degree left turn, and a bottom section consisting of two highly scenic, fee-hanging rappels. In the upper section there are countless ways to get through the series of about 10 potholes; two sandtrap rappels usually get it done most efficiently- after stemming over the first one and partner-capturing into the second one, set up a sandtrap rappel from the 3rd pothole of 40 foot through two potholes, then set up another sandtrap for a 50 foot 3-tier rappel. The exit described in Bluugnome seems to exit at the 1/2 way point and misses two very worthwhile rappels. The penultimate rappel is anchored off a sandtrap and goes 85 feet down 3 tiers. Continue hiking down the drainage to a spectacular pouroff which can be anchored off a massive horn or numerous boulders and drops 75 feet, all free-hanging. Hike 5 minutes down the open wash at the bottom to a scramble up LDC to head directly to the viewpoint, or do an easy walk out RDC to head over to the Euphrates exit. Exiting this way takes 1 hour to 1 hour 15 minutes.

Approach

Descent

Exit

Red tape

Trip reports and media

Background

properties.name: pkEuphrates
properties.description: Park hear at a tee in the road to begin the route over to Euphrates. (Data by bluugnome.com)

properties.name: wEuphrateRP-01
properties.description: Point to start dropping down from the level you parked on. (Data by bluugnome.com)

properties.name: wEuphrateRP-02
properties.description: Top of a rubble pile allowing a way up or down from the rim here. If exiting up go up the rubble pile then veer right (northeast) and route find your way back to teh Euphrates parking spot. If going down to Tripoli drop down the hill then turn right (southwest) and walk along the base of the cliff band. If going down to Euphrates drop down the hill then continue down to the head of Euphrates below. If going down to the Teeny Tiny Loop drop down the hill then turn left (east) and walk along the top of the slick rock just below the dirt. (Data by bluugnome.com)

properties.name: TeenyTiny01
properties.description: Go around the point here and continue walking northeast just under the base of the cliff band for about 1100 feet over to under the next point on the mesa. Staying high and following just below the dirt makes for the easiest travel. (Data by bluugnome.com)

properties.name: TeenyTiny02
properties.description: Route goes under the next point on the mesa. To continue to the Teeny Tiny Loop; walk south east down the slope away from the cliff band. As you walk follow down the slope next to a shallow drainage with a little vegetation. The goal is to get to a small valley about 0.32 miles away that can almost be seen from the point. (Data by bluugnome.com)

properties.name: TeenyTiny03
properties.description: Small valley. To continue on the Teeny Tiny Loop veer right (south) and walk up a short sandy drainage that turns to slickrock about 180 feet away. Note: There are a couple short but steep dropping slots to the north of here but neither seemed to elicit a desire to go down them when we looked at them. (Data by bluugnome.com)

properties.name: TeenyTiny04
properties.description: Small drainage turns from sand to going up slickrock. Continue south up the slickrock with a 4 foot and a 6 foot upclimb (both easy) along the way. The drainage will slowly veer left to travel more south east and finally top out on a small saddle a little over 500 feet up from the small valley. (Data by bluugnome.com)

properties.name: TeenyTiny05
properties.description: Saddle with drainages running down both sides. To continue on the Teeny Tiny Loop continue down the drainage to the south east about 200 feet to where it opens up to another wide open sandy area. During the exit continue down the drainage to the northwest. Instead of going all the way back down to the sandy valley used on the approach; you can optionally veer left and travel northwest up a minor drainage then route find your way up along rolling slickrock. (Data by bluugnome.com)

properties.name: TeenyTiny06
properties.description: Bottom of a small drainage down from a saddle and where it opens up to a wide open sandy area. To continue on the Teeny Tiny Loop turn right and walk up the slick rock to another small saddle about 250 feet away. Note: For an alternate choice with a scenic treat walk across the open sandy area about 650 feet to get a great view over toward Lake Powell. If you choose to do this you can just walk south around the hill to meet up with the route you would have used if going up over the saddle. (Data by bluugnome.com)

properties.name: sTinyView
properties.description: Awesome view from the top of a cliff here. To meet up with the Teeny Tiny Loop route again travel southwest around the hill then north. (Data by bluugnome.com)

properties.name: TeenyTiny07
properties.description: Small saddle. Walk and scramble your way south down the slickrock then into a dirt area and over to the head of a large drainage about 300 feet away. (Data by bluugnome.com)

properties.name: yTeenyTp
properties.description: Top of Teeny Canyon which drops steeply down to the south. Bypass this upper portion of Teeny Canyon by walking right (west) to a ledge to walk around this upper section and drop into Teeny Canyon a little farther down. (Data by bluugnome.com)

properties.name: TeenyTiny08
properties.description: The narrowest spot (TeenyTiny08) on the ledge 400 foot long ledge is about 4 feet wide. The ledge traverses from the head of Teeny Canyon over to a wide flat dirt area. When you get to the wide dirt area; walk southwest about 100 feet to the other end where you can then scramble down. (Data by bluugnome.com)

properties.name: TeenyTiny09
properties.description: Southwest end of a wide sandy area after traversing along a ledge. Scramble south down loose rock and dirt down about 100 feet to slickrock below. Once down to the slickrock level route find your way south along the slickrock around a point into a small side drainage which can be used to get down into Teeny Canyon. (Data by bluugnome.com)

properties.name: TeenyTiny10
properties.description: On the route into Teeny Canyon scramble down the small runnel here to the floor of the canyon. On the exit from Tiny Canyon stay high and turn left (northwest) and route find your way back up to the rim where the approach route traversed the ledge by upper Teeny Canyon. From there reverse the approach route back to the car. (Data by bluugnome.com)

properties.name: TeenyTiny11
properties.description: Down in Teeny Canyon. Turn right to walk south about 40 feet to rap 1. (Data by bluugnome.com)

properties.name: dTeenyR1-2
properties.description: Raps 1 and 2 - Teeny Canyon. Rap 1 is anchored from a small bush about 30 feet back and drops about 25 feet down a vertical drop to a sandy floor. Rap 2 about 60 feet down canyon of rap 1 is anchored using a sandtrap and drops about 50 feet to a very large sand filled pothole. A little over 100 feet after rap 2 is the start of a narrow slot. (Data by bluugnome.com)

properties.name: TeenyTiny12
properties.description: Easy stem style downclimb of about 15 feet down into a corridor a little over 200 feet long. (Data by bluugnome.com)

properties.name: TeenyTiny13
properties.description: Easy downclimb of about 20 feet then continue into more open corridor. (Data by bluugnome.com)

properties.name: TeenyTiny14
properties.description: Downclimb of about 15 feet into another crack then another downclimb of about 15 feet again. From here walk about 350 feet to where the drainage turns right (south) and a small side drainage joins in from the left. (Data by bluugnome.com)

properties.name: yTeenyBt
properties.description: Bottom of Teeny Canyon. To go out to a great view point over Lake Powel you can take a side trip about 0.8 miles round trip south down the drainage. To Exit the area and or go over to Tiny Canyon start scrambling west up the base of the sandstone point on the RDC side and route find your way up the slickrock roughly paralleling back up Teeny Canyon on its RDC side. (Data by bluugnome.com)

properties.name: TeenyView01
properties.description: Shelf in the wash of about 20 feet that is easily bypassed on either side. (Data by bluugnome.com)

properties.name: TeenyView02
properties.description: Huge drop / shelf in the wash. Leave the drainage here and route find your way southeast about 700 feet to the top of the cliff looking down over Lake Powell. (Data by bluugnome.com)

properties.name: Teeny-BM
properties.description: Bench mark near teh scenic overlook on the Teeny Tiny Loop. (Data by bluugnome.com)

properties.name: sTeenyView
properties.description: Awesome views out over Lake Powell and makes for a gret side trip / lunch break. (Data by bluugnome.com)

properties.name: TeenyTiny15
properties.description: After exiting Teeny Canyon start scrambling up the base of the sandstone point on the RDC side. It is steep for about 70 feet then the slope gets much more gentle. As you continue up stay as far left / up as possible and work your way up to the west about 500 feet to where you have good views down over toward the top portion of Teeny Canyon you bypassed on the approach. (Data by bluugnome.com)

properties.name: TeenyTiny16
properties.description: From here you can see down toward the upper portion of Teeny Canyon to the north and are almost topped out on a slickrock hill. To continue to Tiny Canyon turn left and walk south about 100 feet to a shallow saddle. Note: If you want to exit without doing Tiny Canyon you can route find your way down to the the approach route above Teeny Canyon and reverse the approach to exit. (Data by bluugnome.com)

properties.name: TeenyTiny17
properties.description: Shallow slickrock saddle. To get to Tiny Canyon travel south down slickrock to a sandy area about 350 feet away. (Data by bluugnome.com)

properties.name: yTinyTp
properties.description: Top of Tiny Canyon at the south end of a sandy area. The first part of the slot is a narrow walk through for about 100 feet to a downclimb. (Data by bluugnome.com)

properties.name: TeenyTiny18
properties.description: Stem style downclimb of about 12 feet followed by a more difficult downclimb of about 10 feet that may require a partner assist for some. At the bottom of the 10 foot downclimb is a sand filled pothole to cross that would be easy to exit if scoured out. On the other side of the pothole is a drop down into another pothole with rap 1 on the other side of the pothole. Note: The drop into this third sand filled pothole when we visited in April of 2015 was about 6 feet with a vertical exit on the other side. At the sand level we had it was an easy climb out of the pothole but if sand scours out of this pothole it will be difficult to exit and a potshot may be needed. (Data by bluugnome.com)

properties.name: dTinyR1
properties.description: Rap 1 - Tiny Canyon. Anchored using a sandtrap in a pothole and uses about 80 feet to go over two drops with a pothole part way down. After rap 1 are two potholes to cross that may require partner assist or potshots to get out of if sand is scoured out. The second pothole taller people can bridge over. A short section of open V slot followed by a left hand bend in the canyon gets you out into an open sandy area at the end of the canyon. (Data by bluugnome.com)

properties.name: yTinyBt
properties.description: Bottom of Tiny Canyon where it dumps out to a wide sandy area. To exit turn immediately right and start west then north up the steep slickrock roughly paralleling Tiny Canyon. The first 130 feet up the slickrock is kind of steep and has loose rock and debris and care should be taken. (Data by bluugnome.com)

properties.name: TeenyTiny19
properties.description: Scramble up becomes less steep. Continue up the less steep slick rock for about 240 feet to the top out. (Data by bluugnome.com)

properties.name: TeenyTiny20
properties.description: Top out of the slickrock. From here route find your way down to the north about 400 feet to another wide sandy area. (Data by bluugnome.com)

properties.name: TeenyTiny21
properties.description: Wide sandy area. Continue north across the sandy spot to a fork then continue north up the right fork. Route find your way about 500 feet to where you are once again on the rim of Teeny Canyon where the approach route started dropping into the canyon. Note: If you turn and walk southeast down this sandy area you will go back to the top of Tiny Canyon. Good to know if you want to do laps on it. (Data by bluugnome.com)

properties.name: TeenyTiny22
properties.description: For an alternate exit continue up the drainage to the northwest then route find up the slickrock and continue northwest to intersect with the approach route again. (Data by bluugnome.com)

properties.name: TeenyTiny23
properties.description: Get up onto this saddle then drop down to the right (northeast) to meet up with the approach route again then continue reversing the approach route back to the car. (Data by bluugnome.com)

properties.description: (Data by bluugnome.com)

properties.description: (Data by bluugnome.com)
